author: costin
msg: Added few test files I had in various places on my machine.
I used them to verify various things, but never had a chance to write
a formal <test> - you may find them useful ( or ignore them if not)
( some are based on bug reports - sorry if I missed the contributor )
- Hello, HelloW are good for testing server overhead ( simple pages
with minimal time spent in the servlet, all the time processing
the request)
- sessionShare used to verify that sessions created in servlets are
visible in jsps
- Policy tests tomcat.policy for servlets ( I also use to build a jar and
put it in lib to verify the policy applies to classes and lib too )
- XXXStream, Writer are usefull to evaluate the overhead of the 3
output methods ( ServletOutputStream/bytes, SOS/chars, writer). Very
interesting ( or it used to be in 3.1, 3.2 ).
- RmiTest - can you start RMI from a servlet ?
- CookieExpire - do we set the cookie expire ?
- Post - I'm not sure if it is supposed to work ( it hangs until you hit
stop in the browser ).
Again - if you don't like them feel free to remove, I find the tests
usefull even if the code is not very clean - just hacks.

author: costin
msg: Added a small policy example ( it should fail if policy is
enabled). I couldn't think of a better example - this is probably
pretty bad ( creates a file in /tmp )

author: costin
msg: Minor fixes in class loading ( for "java -jar tomcat.jar"), plus
command line options.
ContextManager now have a property names "serverClassPath" containing
the classpath used internaly by tomcat ( the one containing jaxp, webserver,
etc) in addition to the parent class loader ( see the discution on tomcat-dev)
- double-check SimpleClassLoader's urls, make sure dir urls end with "/"
( this avoids one file access per cpath component)

author: larryi
msg: For the PATH environment variable, Win9x wants paths that contain spaces
to be enclosed in quotes.

msg: For the PATH environment variable, Win9x wants paths that contain spaces
